content: csenge anna baby cardigan and hat set disclaimer this pattern and photographs are the property of k a m e crochet by krisztina anna matejcsok-edomer and should be used for personal and non-commercial use you may not alter or sell this pattern in any way you may sell finished products but please credit k a m e crochet if you can thank you difficulty beginner to intermediate size 0-3 months to fit approx 16 inch chest finished length from shoulder approx 10 5 inches sleeve length from under arm to cuff 5 inches materials needed  4 mm g size hook  approx 135-140 grams of baby dk yarn or any dk yarn suitable i used knitting essentials in bright pink colorway  yarn needle for weaving in ends  scissors  3 small buttons k a m e crochet designs 2018 by krisztina anna matejcsok-edomer all rights reserved stitches used and abbreviations magic_ring = magic_ring skip= skip space= space chain = chain st/sts= stitch/ stitches dnt = do not turn rs = right side slip_stitch = slip_stitch single_crochet = single_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet fpdc = front post double_crochet bpdc = back post double_crochet star stitch *-* =repeat pattern between these symbols additional notes  us terms used throughout additional terms/ special stitches front post double_crochet yarn over insert your hook from the front around the post of given stitch from right to left yarn over and finish your double_crochet as usual back post single_crochet insert your hook from the back around the post of given stitch yarn over and finish your single crochet as usual back post double_crochet yarn over insert your hook from the back around the post of given stitch yarn over and finish your double_crochet as usual k a m e crochet designs 2018 by krisztina anna matejcsok-edomer all rights reserved star stitch important the star stitch is made of two row row 1 chain 3 insert your hook into the second chain from the hook yarn over and pull p a loop there will be two loops on the hook insert your hook into the next chain then yarn over and pull up a loop there will be three loops on the hook insert your hook into each of the next three stitches doing a yarn over and pull through in each so that you have six stitches on the hook yarn over and pull through all six loops on the hook chain one to close the star this creates the eye of the first star next insert your hook into the eye that you just made yarn over and pull through there will now be two loops on your hook insert your hook into the space between the two last spikes from the first star yarn over and pull through there will be three loops on your hook insert your hook into the same stitch where you worked the last stitch of the previous star yarn over and pull through there
